channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Could Arsenal win Premier League without a regular goalscorer?
item.description: No team has ever won the Premier League title without having a player in the top 10 goalscorers, but could Arsenal change that?

item.title: 'The game has gone' - a bad night for VAR in semi-final
item.description: Manchester City's 2-0 win over Newcastle in the first leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final was overshadowed by a contentious decision to disallow a goal from Antoine Semenyo in the second half.

item.title: Why has no English boss won Premier League - and who could be first?
item.description: Why has an English manager not won the Premier League? Chief football writer Phil McNulty explores who could make history.

item.title: Why Osimhen has become 'king of Nigerian football'
item.description: Nigeria face a huge semi-final against Africa Cup of Nations hosts and favourites Morocco on Wednesday.

item.title: Semenyo scores again - who are winners and losers of his arrival?
item.description: Antoine Semenyo has taken to life seamlessly at Manchester City by hitting the ground running and is already beginning to repay the £62.5m fee Pep Guardiola handed to Bournemouth to sign him.

item.title: Hasty or a shrewd move? Madrid in shock at swift Arbeloa appointment
item.description: Many Real Madrid fans are in shock at Alvaro Arbeloa's appointment as manager - is it a hasty move or a shrewd decision?

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Trump's foreign policy and what it might mean for the World Cup
item.description: As a group of cross-party MPs calls on Fifa to consider expelling the USA from the World Cup, BBC Sport analyses what Donald Trump’s foreign policy means for the tournament.

item.title: Is Carrick the right man for Man Utd?
item.description: Michael Carrick is appointed as Manchester United's interim manager. Simon Stone assesses if he is the right fit for the job.

item.title: Rosenior to talk to Sterling and Disasi about Chelsea exile
item.description: New Chelsea manager has pledged to speak to Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi, who were left in limbo by the previous boss.

item.title: Chelsea and Scotland legend McCreadie dies aged 85
item.description: Former Scotland and Chelsea player Eddie McCreadie, who was once hailed by Tommy Docherty as the best left-back in Europe and went on to manage the London club, dies at the age of 85.

item.title: Salah-Mane rivalry renewed in Afcon semi-finals
item.description: Mohamed Salah's Egypt will face Senegal in the Afcon 2025 semi-finals, offering the chance of revenge against his old Liverpool team-mate Sadio Mane.

item.title: Watch trailer for Mo Salah: Never Give Up
item.description: Watch the trailer for BBC documentary Mo Salah: Never Give Up.

item.title: Rodri and Cisse star in best goals of the FA Cup third round
item.description: Watch the best goals from across the FA Cup third-round weekend, including Isaac Buckley-Ricketts' stunner for Macclesfield FC.

item.title: Late goals add shine as Liverpool beat spirited Barnsley in FA Cup
item.description: Liverpool score two late goals to add shine to their FA Cup third round victory over spirited League One side Barnsley at Anfield.

item.title: Carrick would bring spirit of Man Utd back - Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney discusses Michael Carrick’s potential role as Manchester United caretaker and whether he’d join the coaching staff.

item.title: Cascarino denied WSL debut because of earring
item.description: West Ham's new signing Estelle Cascarino was denied a chance to make her Women's Super League debut because of an earring.

item.title: Afcon quiz: Name every Africa Cup of Nations winner
item.description: With the Africa Cup of Nations kicking off on Sunday, 21 December, can you name every tournament winner?

item.title: Man City prepare Guehi offer - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Manchester City prepare offer for Marc Guehi, Bayern Munich chief tries to convince the Crystal Palace defender, and Rashford return to Manchester United is off the cards.

item.title: Gabon's government lifts sanctions on team and Aubameyang
item.description: Gabon's government lifts the sanctions it imposed on the national team and striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang after their exit from Afcon 2025.

item.title: Football fan died after being targeted by 'predatory' gambling sites
item.description: A coroner concludes that a 36-year-old Liverpool fan took his own life after he was enticed to use illegal gambling websites to bet on football matches.

item.title: VAR errors increase: Each of the 13 mistakes so far this season
item.description: The Premier League's KMI Panel makes judgements on every key decisions. Here's what they say the VAR has got wrong.

item.title: Spurs set to beat Villa to £35m Gallagher
item.description: Tottenham expect to complete a £35m deal for Conor Gallagher after moving ahead of Aston Villa in the race for the England international's signature.

item.title: Rooney & Heathcote reflect on Macclesfield's 'incredible' cup win
item.description: Macclesfield manager John Rooney and defender Sam Heathcote talk to BBC Breakfast about their stunning FA Cup upset over holders Crystal Palace.

item.title: Welbeck scores as Brighton knock Man Utd out of FA Cup
item.description: Striker Danny Welbeck helps Brighton dump his former club Manchester United out of the FA Cup at Old Trafford.

item.title: Watch every angle of Gordon's save of the season contender
item.description: Watch Hearts goalkeeper Craig Gordon's impressive late save in his side's 1-0 win at Dundee from different angles.

item.title: Arsenal beat Portsmouth thanks to Martinelli hat-trick
item.description: Gabriel Martinelli scores the first hat-trick of his senior career as an Arsenal side showing 10 changes come from a goal down to beat Championship side Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: Leeds avoid upset with second-half comeback against Derby
item.description: James Justin scored his first goal for Leeds United since joining from Leicester City in the summer, in a second-half comeback after Derby County took the lead thanks to a Ben Brereton Diaz strike.

item.title: Macclesfield to host Brentford in FA Cup fourth round - see full draw
item.description: Sixth-tier Macclesfield are rewarded with a home tie against Brentford in the FA Cup fourth round after their shock win over holders Crystal Palace.

item.title: Why Alonso's reign is over at Real Madrid
item.description: After Xabi Alonso's departure as Real Madrid manager, Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks into where it all went wrong.

item.title: Carrick confirmed as Man Utd caretaker head coach
item.description: Manchester United appoint former player Michael Carrick as caretaker head coach until the end of the season.

item.title: A 'weird' and 'incredible' error - but was Szoboszlai disrespectful?
item.description: Liverpool beat Barnsley 4-1 in FA Cup fourth round but it was Dominik Szoboszlai's first-half error that had lots of people talking.

item.title: Castellanos scores in extra time as West Ham edge past QPR
item.description: Valentin 'Taty' Castellanos scores his first goal for West Ham United as they beat Queens Park Rangers in extra time and progress to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Watch best of Saturday's weather-affected SPFL action
item.description: Watch the best of the action from Saturday's weather-affected Scottish Championship, League 1 and League 2 programme.

item.title: Two for Reed as Mansfield upset Sheff Utd in thriller
item.description: Mansfield Town cause one of the shocks of the FA Cup third round with a stunning victory over Sheffield United in a seven-goal thriller at Bramall Lane.

item.title: Magic Makama hat-trick as Norwich beat Walsall
item.description: Twenty-one-year-old Jovon Makama scores a hat-trick as Norwich City beat Walsall in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: Man City beat Everton at home to strengthen grip on WSL title
item.description: Manchester City consolidate their place at the top of the Women's Super League table with a convincing win over Everton.

item.title: Hearts agree pre-contract with Uganda forward Mato
item.description: Uganda and Vargar forward Rogers Mato signs a pre-contract agreement to join Scottish Premiership leaders Heart of Midlothian this summer.

item.title: Cancelo returns to Barcelona on loan
item.description: Barcelona announce the signing of former Manchester City defender Joao Cancelo on loan until the end of the season.

item.title: 'I'd take him back in a heartbeat' - which players return to haunt old clubs?
item.description: After Brighton's Danny Welbeck scored again against Manchester United on Sunday, who has the best record against their former clubs in the Premier League era?

item.title: Can you name every EFL Cup-winning team in 10 minutes?
item.description: This season is the 66th edition of the EFL Cup... but can you name the winners of the other 65? You've got 10 minutes. Good luck.

item.title: Manager Alonso leaves Real Madrid as Arbeloa takes charge
item.description: Xabi Alonso leaves his position as Real Madrid manager after less than eight months in charge as former Liverpool team-mate Alvaro Arbeloa is appointed as replacement.

item.title: Villa sign Chelsea's Jean-Francois for £450K
item.description: Aston Villa sign Chelsea and France midfielder Oriane Jean-Francois for £450,000.

item.title: Celtic's Jota likely out for season & Welsh could return to Well
item.description: Recalled centre-half Stephen Welsh could return to Motherwell before the end of the January transfer window, interim Celtic manager Martin O'Neill has suggested while admitting he does not expect injured winger Jota to play again this season.

item.title: West Ham reluctant to sell Paqueta amid interest
item.description: West Ham are reluctant to sanction a sale for Lucas Paqueta this month amid interest in the attacker from Brazil.

item.title: Are fans being turned off multi-club ownership model?
item.description: Strasbourg fans thought they had it good from being aligned with Chelsea. Then manager Liam Rosenior walked out mid-season to take charge of the Blues.

item.title: Cascarino earring a 'schoolgirl error' - Williams
item.description: Fara Williams says West Ham's Estelle Cascarino made a "schoolgirl error" by being denied a debut because she could not remove an earring.

item.title: Eritrea included in Afcon 2027 preliminary qualifying
item.description: Eritrea are included in the preliminary qualifying round draw for the 2027 Africa Cup of Nations despite being unranked by world governing body Fifa.

item.title: A 'new sport' with 'room to improve' - how is Baller League doing?
item.description: After the conclusion of Baller League UK season two, BBC Sport looks at how the six-a-side format is progressing.

item.title: FA Cup quiz: Name every non-league team that has beaten a top-flight side
item.description: Crystal Palace became the ninth top-flight side to be knocked out of the FA Cup by a non-league team in the past 100 years.

item.title: Is Macclesfield beating Crystal Palace greatest FA Cup upset?
item.description: After Macclesfield beat FA Cup holders Crystal Palace in the third round, BBC Sport looks at 10 of the biggest upsets in the competition's history.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: 'Big personality' Martinelli goes from 'idiot' to hat-trick hero
item.description: Gabriel Martinelli was branded an "idiot" a few days ago - but showed great personality to respond with an FA Cup hat-trick, according to Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta.

item.title: Another door closes for Spurs and Frank with damaging FA Cup exit
item.description: After Spurs' damaging FA Cup exit at home to Aston Villa, chief football writer Phil McNulty asks how long can head coach Thomas Frank survive?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How much is the prize money for the men's and women's FA Cup?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain the prize money for the men and women's FA Cup this season.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Why is the Spanish Super Cup played in Saudi Arabia?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why the Spanish Super Cup is being played in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: How does Amorim's record compare to other Man Utd managers?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Ruben Amorim's record as a Manchester United manager and how it compares to other previous bosses

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: When does the January transfer window open and close?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team look at when the 2026 January transfer window opens.

item.title: Rangers close to loan deal for Olsen - gossip
item.description: Danish winger close to completing loan move to Ibrox as Celtic continue pursuit of Serbia striker...

item.title: McGlynn happy at Falkirk but wonders what money could bring
item.description: John McGlynn insists he is happy helping Falkirk exceed expectations on their return to the Scottish top flight but admits "it would be interesting" if one day he was asked to manage a club with money to spend on players.

item.title: O'Neil succeeds Rosenior as Strasbourg manager
item.description: Gary O'Neil is appointed Strasbourg manager after Liam Rosenior left the French Ligue 1 side to join Chelsea earlier this week.

item.title: Blackburn to Barcelona - Dolan's 'unbelievable' journey to Espanyol
item.description: Five years ago, Tyrhys Dolan was playing for Clitheroe - now he is preparing to face Barcelona in the Catalan derby.

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: Hojlund permanent Napoli move a 'formality'
item.description: Striker Rasmus Hojlund completing his permanent transfer from Manchester United to Napoli is a "formality", says Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna.

item.title: Are 'efficient' Chelsea ready to chase down titles?
item.description: Having won the past six Women's Super League titles, Chelsea have not had to chase for a while. But they are up for the challenge this time.

item.title: Maestre wants London City players to match his ambition
item.description: Eder Maestre challenges London City Lionesses players to match his ambition after his managerial tenure with the Women's Super League club begins with a drab goalless draw against Liverpool.

item.title: Ipswich Women appoint Burt as technical director
item.description: WSL2 club Ipswich Town Women appoint Sean Burt, Hearts head of recruitment, as their technical director.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
